dcm.report module#

Base classes for all reporting infrastructure

Most high-level operations are in fact batch operations which large numbers of sub-operations. In is not uncommon for these sub-operations to produces errors or warning statuses that shouldn’t interrupt the whole batch operation. We use a variety of “report” classes to capture this kind of information and provide real-time insight into an ongoing async operation.

Exceptions:

MultiError

MultiKeyedError

Classes:

BaseReport

Abstract base class for all reports

CountableReport

Abstract base class for reports with single "count"

MultiAttrReport

Abstract base class combining a few sub-reports as attrs

MultiDictReport

Collection of related reports, each identified with a unique key

MultiListReport

Sequence of reports of the same type

MultiReport

Abstract base class for reports that contain other sub-reports

ProgressHookBase

Base class for hooking in to progress updates from a report

ProgressTaskBase

ProgressTaskBase(description: str, total: Union[int, NoneType], start_time: datetime.datetime, min_seconds: float, show_indeterminate: bool)

RichProgressHook

Hook for console progress bar provided by rich package

RichProgressTask

RichProgressTask(description: str, total: Union[int, NoneType], start_time: datetime.datetime, min_seconds: float, show_indeterminate: bool)

SummaryReport

Abstract base class for all SummaryReports

Attributes:

has_errors

True if any errors were reported

has_warnings

True if any warnings were reported

n_errors

Number of errors, where a single input can cause multiple errors

n_expected

Number of expected inputs, or None if unknown

n_input

Number of inputs seen so far

n_success

Number of successfully handled inputs

n_warnings

Number of warnings, where a single input can cause multiple warnings
